column1: It is often hard to see or prove this kind of abuse, so other people are less likely to help the child.

They may have: - Problems in school - Eating disorders, leading to weight loss or poor weight gain - Emotional issues such as low self-esteem, depression, and anxiety - Extreme behavior such as acting out, trying hard to please, aggressiveness - Trouble sleeping - Vague physical complaints CHILD NEGLECT These are examples of child neglect: - Rejecting the child and not giving the child any love - Not feeding the child - Not dressing the child in proper clothing - Not giving needed medical or dental care - Leaving a child alone for a long time.

- The adult in their life does not seem to care about the child, is depressed, shows bizarre behavior, or uses alcohol or drugs WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP If you think a child is in immediate danger because of abuse or neglect, call 911.
